text:
The logger seems to throw this exception continually in the class specified in 
the stack trace.  However it does not initially throw the exception.  


The issue is that I'm not putting try/catch around my logger.xxxxx(String) 
methods, so this type of error will crash the current method.


config file:
log4j.rootLogger=debug, stdout, standard

log4j.appender.standard=org.apache.log4j.RollingFileAppender
log4j.appender.standard.File=c:\\temp\\general.log
log4j.appender.standard.MaxFileSize=10000KB
log4j.appender.standard.layout=org.apache.log4j.PatternLayout
log4j.appender.standard.layout.ConversionPattern=[%d{HH:mm:ss,SSS}] - %p - (%F:%
L) - %m%n

log4j.appender.stdout=org.apache.log4j.ConsoleAppender
log4j.appender.stdout.layout=org.apache.log4j.PatternLayout
log4j.appender.stdout.layout.ConversionPattern=[%d{HH:mm:ss,SSS}] - %p - (%F:%
L) - %m%n

Stack Trace:
java.lang.ClassCastException: org.apache.log4j.Logger
	at org.apache.log4j.helpers.AppenderAttachableImpl.appendLoopOnAppenders
(AppenderAttachableImpl.java(Compiled Code))

creator: darin.howard@commercebank.com
ceki@apache.org
text:
It would be useful to have the line number where the class cast exception 
occurs. Are you using a sub-class of Logger? Are you using commons-logging? Do 
you have multiple copies of log4j.jar files in your system?

creator: darin.howard@commercebank.com
text:
here is the manifest information from the log4j jar file i'm using (log4j-
1.2.6.jar):

Manifest-Version: 1.0
Created-By: Ant 1.4

Name: org/apache/log4j/
Implementation-Vendor: "Apache Software Foundation"
Implementation-Version: 1.2.6
Implementation-Title: log4j

I'm did a quick search and this is the only log4j jar file in my classpath and 
on my system.

I'll see if I can get the stack trace with line numbers as well.

Thanks.

Given the length of time since the original report and the fact nothing further 
was posted, and I can't reproduce this error, I'm closing this item.
creator: yoavs@computer.org
